communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The amount of money allocated by Department of Homeland Security (DHS) / Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) to fund the ICS-CERT program (reference: https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics) for the 2023 calendar year. This includes personnel, materials, computers, and applicable expenditures such as travel. This request is for records *specific to ICS-CERT*, not the larger US-CERT program.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Martin

title: DHS/CISA: 2023 National Cyber Awareness System Bulletin Budget

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The amount of money allocated by Department of Homeland Security (DHS) / Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) to fund the generation and publication of the National Cyber Awareness System Bulletins (reference: https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/bulletins) for the 2023 calendar year. This includes personnel, materials, computers, hours required, and applicable expenditures related to the publication of the "SB" bulletins, and only those bulletins. If it is easier to determine the cost to generate a single weekly bulletin (e.g. https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/bulletins/sb21-046) then I can extrapolate a rough cost for the year and that is acceptable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Martin

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

re: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2023/12/01/cisa-removes-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

Please share any documentation, correspondence, or information pertaining to:
1) What information was provided to CISA that warranted CVE-2022-28958 initially being added to the Known Exploited Vulnerability (KEV) catalog?
2) What information was provided to CISA that prompted removing CVE-2022-28958 from the catalog?

Additionally:

3) Has an audit been performed to determine if other vulnerabilities currently on the KEV are reasonably expected to be present?
4) What are the official criteria and evidence required by CISA to include a vulnerability on the KEV?

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Martin
